intro: Cyclopogon apricus, commonly known as the yellow cyclopogon, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline environments. It has strap-like leaves and produces small, clustered blooms. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
